intro: Pachyplectron, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. The plants typically have a short, stout stem and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. They are native to regions in North and South America, with some species also occurring in parts of Africa. Pachyplectron species are generally herbaceous and have small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
